[[Image:Nero Linux.png|thumb|275px|Screenshot of Nero Linux]]
'''Nero Burning ROM''', commonly called just '''Nero''', is a popular [[optical disc authoring software|optical disc authoring program]] for [[Microsoft Windows]] and [[Linux]] by [[Nero AG]], formerly [[Ahead Software]].<ref name="theinquirer">{{cite news | url = http://www.theinquirer.net/default.aspx?article=37873 | title = 'Nero Lite' and 'Nero Micro': smaller sometimes is better | first = Fernando | last = Cassia | date = 2007-02-27 | publisher = [[The Inquirer]] | accessdate = 2007-03-07 }}</ref> Now the program is usually a part of various [[Nero (computer software)|software suite]]s—such as ''Nero 7 Premium Reloaded''—most of which also bears the designation [[Nero (computer software)|Nero]].
'''Nero Burning ROM''', commonly called just '''Nero''', is a popular [[optical disc authoring software|optical disc authoring program]] for [[Microsoft Windows]] and [[Linux]] by [[Nero AG]], formerly [[Ahead Software]].<ref name="theinquirer">{{cite news | url = http://www.theinquirer.net/default.aspx?article=37873 | title = 'Nero Lite' and 'Nero Micro': smaller sometimes is better | first = Fernando | last = Cassia | date = 2007-02-27 | publisher = [[The Inquirer]] | accessdate = 2007-03-07 }}</ref> Now the program is usually a part of various [[Nero (computer software)|software suite]]s—such as ''Nero 7 Premium Reloaded''—most of which also bears the designation [[Nero (computer software)|Nero]].
